info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 1:02PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Delta and west central Gunnison Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 101 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Paonia, or 38 miles northeast of Montrose, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Delta and west central Gunnison Counties, including the following locations... Bowie and Somerset. This includes Colorado 133 between mile markers 10 and 23, and between mile markers 27 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
